授業の概要・背景: The world economic crisis, the bubble bursting in the 1990s and a decade of recession has led to numerous changes in the Japanese employment system. While many Japanese companies have adjusted their management to cope with these changes, the basic principles of the Japanese labor market are still intact. This seminar gives an overview of these principles, investigates to what extent the Japanese employment system has transformed and how it differs from the system in the US.
授業方法: COIL class. Using a Collaborative Online International Learning (COIL) approach, students in this class will work online together with American students on several activities. After creating introductory videos and team building activities, students will work out the differences in HR management and employment between Japan and the US with their American partners and present their findings in class. Based on weekly readings and class discussions, students will also gain an understanding of characteristics and phenomena of the Japanese employment system, supplemented by materials from the instructor, such as newspaper articles, recent statistics and film clips from documentaries and interviews.
